etymologies: 1930s: abbreviation of its chemical name, a(lpha-)m(ethyl) phe(ne)t(hyl)amine

definitions: a synthetic, addictive, mood-altering drug, used illegally as a stimulant and legally as a prescription drug to treat children with ADD and adults with narcolepsy

examples.text: the amphetamine put him on a high for an hour
he was jailed for three months for possessing amphetamines

notes.text: Alternative name: 1-phenyl-2-aminopropane (or one of its salts, especially amphetamine sulfate); chemical formula: C₆H₅CH₂CH(CH₃)NH₂

shortDefinitions: synthetic, addictive, mood-altering drug, used illegally as stimulant
